result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas C Churchill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: Any Current Sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
DNA Surcharge Waived.

Court Costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Follow through with AODA treatment, counseling.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Nicholas C Churchill in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to strike the repeater from Count 1.  Court grants motion.  Repeater struck from Count 1.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.    Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 2 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year, Extended Supervision: 1 year) CONSECUTIVE to any current sentence
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Conditions of Extended Supervision: Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Nicholas C Churchill in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Erik J. Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant to remain in the Waukesha County Jail until his next hearing.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.
